snippet: This feature from the Israeli director Avishai Sivan employs fanciful imagery in dark but often funny ways, without abandoning empathy.
abstract: A O Scott reviews movie Tikkun, written and directed by Avishai Sivan.
lead_paragraph: This feature from the Israeli director Avishai Sivan employs fanciful imagery in dark but often funny ways, without abandoning empathy.

headline.main: Review: In ‘Tikkun,’ a Hasidic Student’s Visions Merge With Metaphor
